movies.title: O Happy Day
movies.plot: Zbynek Brynych's forgotten masterpiece "Oh Happy Day" is best described as coming-of-age-psychedelia.
movies.simplePlot: Zbynek Brynych's forgotten masterpiece "Oh Happy Day" is best described as coming-of-age-psychedelia.

biography.bio: Anne-Marie Kuster was born in 1945. She is an actress, known for Deep End (1970), O Happy Day (1970) and Lehmanns Erzählungen (1975).
biography.name: Anne-Marie Kuster

biography.placeOfBirth: Breslau, Silesia, Germany [now Wroclaw, Dolnoslaskie, Poland]
biography.bio: Amadeus August was born on May 6, 1942 in Breslau, Silesia, Germany. He was an actor, known for Poor Little Rich Girl: The Barbara Hutton Story (1987), Bloody Friday (1972) and Der grüne Stern (1982). He died on July 6, 1992 in Munich, Bavaria, Germany.
biography.name: Amadeus August

biography.bio: Hanne Wieder was born on May 8, 1925 in Hannoversch Münden, Germany. She was an actress, known for The Haunted Castle (1960), Rosemary (1958) and La Maison de Montevideo (1963). She was married to Heinz Schimmelpfennig. She died on May 11, 1990 in Feldafing, Bavaria, Germany.
biography.name: Hanne Wieder

biography.bio: Eckart Dux was born on December 19, 1926 in Berlin, Germany. He is an actor, known for Les cavaliers de la route (1966), Butler Parker (1972) and Hamburg Transit (1970). He is married to Marlies Dux. He was previously married to Gisela Peltzer.
biography.name: Eckart Dux

biography.bio: Siegfried Rauch was born on April 2, 1932 in Landsberg am Lech, Bavaria, Germany. He is an actor, known for Mountain Medic (2008), Wildbach (1993) and Patton (1970). He has been married to Karin Rauch since 1964. They have two children.
biography.name: Siegfried Rauch

biography.bio: Tall, dark-haired German leading actor, the son of a blacksmith. Vogler was educated in Innsbruck and Vienna, where he studied psychology and art history, in addition to taking acting classes on the side. He made his theatrical debut in Innsbruck in 1950, then acted in classical roles on stage in Germany, including as Horatio in Hamlet, and as Marquis Posa in 'Don Karlos'. On screen from the late 1950's, he achieved international acclaim through his portrayal of stalwart Prussian officers in several expensive, all-star productions, notably Those Magnificent Men in Their Flying Machines or How I Flew from London to Paris in 25 hours 11 minutes (1965), The Blue Max (1966), Patton (1970) (as Field Marshal Erwin Rommel) and Shout at the Devil (1976). A likeable and reassuring screen presence and possessed of a well-intoned, resonant speaking voice, Vogler became immensely popular on German television from the mid-1970's. He is best remembered as the titular hero of Kara Ben Nemsi Effendi (1973), based on the adventure stories of Karl May, set in the 19th century Ottoman Empire. The 80's and 90's saw Vogler in recurring roles in varying genres, from medical soap opera to sitcoms and satire. He also guested on 'crime time' shows like Inspecteur Derrick (1974) and Tatort (1970). After his retirement from the screen, he devoted time to recording audio books and giving public recitals of German literary classics (often to the accompaniment of jazz), from poems to fairy tales and short stories by, among others, Johann Wolfgang von Goethe, Theodor Storm and Joseph Freiherr von Eichendorff.
biography.name: Karl Michael Vogler

biography.bio: Nadja Tiller was born on March 16, 1929 in Vienna, Austria as Maria Nadja Tiller. She is an actress, known for Barefoot (2005), Rosemary (1958) and L'Aventurière bien-aimée (1961). She was previously married to Walter Giller.
biography.name: Nadja Tiller

biography.bio: Peter Kern was born on February 13, 1949 in Vienna, Austria. He was an actor and director, known for Initiation (2009), Belief, Love, Death (2012) and Hitler, un film d'Allemagne (1977). He died on August 26, 2015 in Austria.
biography.name: Peter Kern
